fields.description: We'll need to wire up the 4.0 Console login form with Eucalyptus.  The login views are at koala/views/login.py.

comments.body: This is missing the remember me stuff, the separator between the login to euca and login to AWS sections, and we aren't using the title wraparound ribbons anymore in 4.0.

Some kind of bad remember me thing is happening. I fired up my local proxy and connected to localhost and the login page looks like the attached screenshot. Not remembering my account info, and putting euca info into the AWS login boxes.
rejected, needs additional work as indicated in comments

Yeah, that's the browser's remember password feature kicking in (which is why we no longer need the "remember me" checkbox).  Unfortunately browsers assume there's only one login form on the page, so we should probably rework the login to have distinct pages for Euca and AWS login.  Which may also be the right approach if/when we support other clouds (GCE?).
If this is what the browser is doing, we may not be able to use it...Separate pages is not an optimal user experience. If we need to rework this we need to discuss it and see what else we can do.
refreshed login page mockup available at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Login+-+refreshed
Please note we may still need to save the acocunt info for euca login in a cookie so the form is complete.
this task blocks the password reset functionality spec'ed for this login screen.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/46

Jenny please review and pass to Kamal afterwards (if things look good)

* no need for remember me checkbox, the browser should be handling that (you may need to work with [~kgill] to get this working right)
* when i log out the account name is not prepopulated for me, and it should be.
* Secret key should say Secret access key
The items above have been addressed. We still need to move AWS signing code to browser per Vika, so keeping this open.
I need to link Steve's ticket for STS changes for IAM
I have code pushed to GUI-251 which handles the new call and provides for creating "iam" connections in the ConnectionManager. Once eucalyptus#testing is updated, we can create a PR for this branch.
